TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG The applicant , Mr. PERSON , was born in DATE . He is a citizen of GPE and , at the time of the domestic proceedings in question , he resided at GPE .

CARDINAL . ORG The applicant came to GPE in DATE to do certain research work at ORG . However , his initial plans did not come to fruition and his financial situation forced him to look for other work . In DATE he found a job at ORG ( PERSON ) . He was , however , obliged to pass a NORP driving test , since he only had an NORP driver ’s licence . On DATE he took the test but failed . This led to an angry exchange of views on CARDINAL DATE between the applicant and the traffic assistant who had been in charge of the test ; subsequently the traffic assistant reported the incident to the police .

CARDINAL . ORG In DATE the applicant was questioned by the police about the matter , and on DATE , he was charged with threatening a civil servant in breach of LAW , section CARDINAL of LAW ( brottsbalken ) .

CARDINAL . ORG During the trial hearing ( huvudförhandling ) before ORG ( NORP tingsrätt ) on DATE , both the applicant and the traffic assistant were heard . On this testimony ORG in a judgment on DATE found the applicant guilty of the charge brought against him and sentenced him to a fine of CARDINAL NORP Crowns ( SEK ) . The costs of the proceedings were to be borne by the ORG . At ORG the applicant was assisted by CARDINAL public defence lawyers .

ORG On DATE , the applicant appealed against this judgment to ORG for Western Sweden ( hovrätten för ORG ) requesting acquittal as he claimed he had not committed the criminal act of which he was accused . Before ORG , he was represented , first by a public defence lawyer and later by a private counsel .
In his first written statement of evidence to ORG on DATE , the applicant took it for granted that a hearing would be held and requested that the traffic assistant appear in person before ORG .

The applicant ’s defence counsel , on DATE , objected to the calling of these CARDINAL new witnesses .
On DATE , ORG informed the parties by means of a written notice that , as the case might be determined without a hearing , they were invited to file their final submissions in writing .

CARDINAL . ORG held no hearing and in its judgment of CARDINAL DATE simply stated : " ORG confirms ORG judgment . "

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE , the applicant appealed to ORG ( högsta domstolen ) . He asked ORG either to quash ORG decision and send the case back for a hearing , or to acquit him , or to remit the sentence imposed .
In support of his claims he stated :

CARDINAL . ORG Under the rules on public access to official documents , contained in the Freedom of LAW ( tryckfrihetsförordningen ) and LAW ( sekretesslagen , CARDINAL ) , the case - files from the courts involved were all available to the public .

CARDINAL . ORG According to LAW of LAW , lower courts shall as a rule render judgment in criminal cases only after the accused has been able to defend himself at an oral hearing . Exceptions to this rule do however exist , particularly at appellate level . Thus LAW , section CARDINAL of LAW , as applicable at the relevant time , stated that :
" ORG may decide the case without a hearing if the prosecutor appeals only for the benefit of the accused or if an appeal lodged by the accused is supported by the opposing party .

The case may be decided without a hearing if the lower court has acquitted the accused or discharged the offender or found him to be exempted from punishment by virtue of mental abnormality or if it has sentenced him to a fine or ordered him to pay a money penalty ( vite ) and there is no reason to impose a more severe sanction than those mentioned above or to impose any other sanction ... "
As of DATE - and therefore after the facts of the present case - this provision has been amended to read as follows in the relevant parts ( NORP Författningssamling CARDINAL:CARDINAL ) :
" ORG may dispose of an appeal on the merits without a hearing ,
CARDINAL . if the prosecutor appeals only for the benefit of the accused ,
CARDINAL . if an appeal brought by the accused is supported by the opposing party ,
CARDINAL . if the appeal is plainly unfounded , or

CARDINAL . if no cause exists to hold the accused legally liable , or to impose a sanction upon him , or to impose a sanction other than a fine or conditional sentence , or a combination of such sanctions .
If , in a case referred to [ above ] , a party has requested a hearing , this shall take place unless manifestly unnecessary .
For a ruling not relating to the merits a hearing need not take place . "

CARDINAL . ORG has the power to review both questions of law and of fact . However , there are certain limitations to ORG full jurisdiction . LAW , LAW ( as amended by Laws DATE : CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) contains a rule proscribing reformatio in pejus in certain cases :

" In an appeal lodged by the accused , or by the prosecutor for the benefit of the accused , ORG may not sentence the accused to a criminal sanction more severe than the one imposed by the lower court . If the accused was sentenced by the lower court to imprisonment , ORG may order suspension of sentence , probation or placing under special care ; in addition to suspension of sentence and to probation or placing under care within the social service , ORG may impose a fine or probation coupled with imprisonment pursuant to LAW , section CARDINAL , of LAW . When the lower court has ordered a sanction of the kind referred to above , ORG may impose a different kind of sanction . "
